list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His mother is worried about his education

Don’t worry me just now – I’m busy!

list_definition.definition: to shake or tear with the teeth etc as a dog does its prey etc.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: That boy is a constant (source of) worry to his mother!

list_ex_of_english: Poverty is worrying about money all the time.
On the face of it, this worry also creates serious difficulties for deliberative democracy.
She was proud, astute, and worried about her husband's welfare.
The objector is worried about persons who may only do moral good in a feasible world in which others do significant wrong.
Yet the fact that we cannot draw any firm policy conclusions at this stage should not worry us unduly.
Lending to a wife probably did not happen very often because it was too risky for lenders worried about delays in repayment.
They loudly poured out their worries, calling on their male relatives to discipline their sons.
We use an equivalence on trees instead of worrying about representation.
